abstracts.cdata!:
The project's main objectives are
            to:  (a) improve sector efficiency and minimize the
            long-term cost of electricity supply in Benin and Togo; (b)
            strengthen the Communaute Electrique du Benin's
            (CEB's) management and operations through technical
            assistance and training; and (c) encourage regional
            cooperation and integration.  The project emphasizes
            technical assistance and training for institutional
            strengthening and regional development, as reflected in the
            following components: (a) updating of the countries'
            least-cost generation, transmission and distribution master
            plans; (b) evaluation of CEB's short-term supply
            requirements, including a review of existing thermal plants,
            and definition of a model for regional power interchange;
            (c) detailed engineering and bidding documents of the
            northern interconnections; (d) the design of standard models
            for substations, towers and conductors for the 161 kV system
            expansion; (e) tariff studies for CEB, the Societe Beninoise
            d'Electricite et d'Eau and the Compagnie Energie
            Electrique du Togo, including an analysis of long run
            marginal costs as a guide to tariff structure and of revenue
            requirements to set the rates; (f) updating supply options,
            including hydroelectric schemes, international
            interconnections and environmental assessment; and (g)
            institutional strengthening of CEB, including training,
            legal, planning and computerization.
